According to sources speaking to the New Yorker, Eric Schmidt 's decision to depart from the role of CEO was intricately linked to Google's decision to pull out of href="http://www.geek.com/articles/tagged/China/"> China due to censorship concerns, with Eric Schmidt becoming frustrated when Larry Page and Sergey Brin sided against him in the controversy. Eric Schmidt apparently felt that Google should stay in China, the world's largest developing market, and he`` lost some energy and focus after losing the China decision.
